title: No other category applies
description_md:
Share of uncoded sentences (quasi-sentences coded with 000)
For Manifesto Project Dataset: 
- Missing information for most documents of Sweden 1949-1982 and Norway 1945-1989
- For all documents that have been coded with version 5 of the Coding Instructions this category is calculated as the sum of 000 codes,
per202_2, per605_2, and per703_2 to ensure comparability with data produced with version 4 of the coding instructions.
For Manifesto Project South America Dataset:
- share of quasi-sentences coded with 000 (without the shares of 202_2, 605_2 and 703_2 codes)
label: percent of uncoded quasi-sentences (000)

title: Foreign Special Relationships: Positive
description_md:
Favourable mentions of particular countries with which the manifesto
country has a special relationship; the need for co-operation with
and/or aid to such countries.
label: foreign special +

title: Foreign Special Relationships: Negative
description_md:
Negative mentions of particular countries with which the manifesto
country has a special relationship.
label: foreign special -

title: Anti-Imperialism
description_md:
Negative references to imperial behaviour and/or negative references to
one state exerting strong influence (political, military or commercial)
over other states. May also include:

-   Negative references to controlling other countries as if they were
    part of an empire;

-   Favourable references to greater self-government and independence
    for colonies;

-   Favourable mentions of de-colonisation.

*For all documents that have been coded with version 5 of the Coding
Instructions this category is calculated as the sum of per103\_1, and
per103\_2.*
label: anti-imperalism

title: Military: Positive
label: military +

title: Military: Negative
label: military -

title: Peace
label: peace

title: Internationalism: Positive
label: internationalism +

title: European Community/Union: Positive
label: europe +

title: Internationalism: Negative
description_md:
Negative references to international co-operation. Favourable mentions
of national independence and sovereignty with regard to the manifesto
country’s foreign policy, isolation and/or unilateralism as opposed to
internationalism.
label: internationalism -

title: European Community/Union: Negative
description_md:
Negative references to the European Community/Union. May include:

-   Opposition to specific European policies which are preferred by
    European authorities;

-   Opposition to the net-contribution of the manifesto country to the
    EU budget.
label: europe -

title: Freedom and Human Rights
label: freedom & human rights

title: Democracy
description_md:
Favourable mentions of democracy as the “only game in town”. General
support for the manifesto country’s democracy. May also include:

-   Democracy as method or goal in national, international or other
    organisations (e.g. labour unions, political parties etc.);

-   The need for the involvement of all citizens in political
    decision-making;

-   Support for either direct or representative democracy;

-   Support for parts of democratic regimes (rule of law, division of
    powers, independence of courts etc.).

*For all documents that have been coded with version 5 of the Coding
Instructions this category is calculated as the sum of per202\_1,
per202\_3, and per202\_4.*
label: democracy

title: Constitutionalism: Positive
description_md:
Support for maintaining the status quo of the constitution. Support for
specific aspects of the manifesto country’s constitution. The use of
constitutionalism as an argument for any policy.
label: constitution +

title: Constitutionalism: Negative
description_md:
Opposition to the entirety or specific aspects of the manifesto
country’s constitution. Calls for constitutional amendments or changes.
May include calls to abolish or rewrite the current constitution.
label: constitution -

title: Decentralization
label: decentralisation

title: Centralisation
description_md:
General opposition to political decision-making at lower political
levels. Support for unitary government and for more centralisation in
political and administrative procedures.
label: centralisation

title: Governmental and Administrative Efficiency
description_md:
Need for efficiency and economy in government and administration and/or
the general appeal to make the process of government and administration
cheaper and more efficient. May include:

-   Restructuring the civil service;

-   Cutting down on the civil service;

-   Improving bureaucratic procedures.

*Note: Specific policy positions overrule this category! If there is no
specific policy position, however, this category applies.*
label: gov-admin efficiency

title: Political Corruption
description_md:
Need to eliminate political corruption and associated abuses of
political and/or bureaucratic power. Need to abolish clientelist
structures and practices.
label: political corruption

title: Political Authority
description_md:
References to the manifesto party’s competence to govern and/or other
party’s lack of such competence. Also includes favourable mentions of
the desirability of a strong and/or stable government in general.

*For all documents that have been coded with version 5 of the Coding
Instructions this category is calculated as the sum of per305\_1,
per305\_2, per305\_3, per305\_4, per305\_5, and per305\_6.*
label: political authority

title: Free Market Economy
label: free market economy

title: Incentives: Positive
label: incentives

title: Market Regulation
label: market regulation

title: Economic Planning
description_md:
Favourable mentions of long-standing economic planning by the
government. May be:

-   Policy plans, strategies, policy patterns etc.;

-   Of a consultative or indicative nature.
label: economic planning

title: Corporatism/Mixed Economy
description_md:
Favourable mentions of cooperation of government, employers, and trade
unions simultaneously. The collaboration of employers and employee
organisations in overall economic planning supervised by the state.

*Note: This category was not used for Austria up to 1979, for New
Zealand up to 1981, and for Sweden up to 1988.*
label: corporatism/mixed economy

title: Protectionism: Positive
label: protectionism +

title: Protectionism: Negative
description_md:
Support for the concept of free trade and open markets. Call for
abolishing all means of market protection (in the manifesto or any other
country).
label: protectionism -

title: Economic Goals
description_md:
Broad and general economic goals that are not mentioned in relation to
any other category. General economic statements that fail to include any
specific goal.

*Note: Specific policy positions overrule this category! If there is no
specific policy position, however, this category applies.*
label: economic goals

title: Keynesian Demand Management
description_md:
Favourable mentions of demand side oriented economic policies
(assistance to consumers rather than businesses). Particularly includes
increase private demand through

-   Increasing public demand;

-   Increasing social expenditures.

May also include:

-   Stabilisation in the face of depression;

-   Government stimulus plans in the face of economic crises.
label: keynesian demand management

title: Economic Growth: Positive
label: economic growth +

title: Technology and Infrastructure: Positive
label: technology & infrastructure

title: Controlled Economy
description_md:
Support for direct government control of economy. May include, for
instance:

-   Control over prices;

-   Introduction of minimum wages.
label: controlled economy

title: Nationalisation
description_md:
Favourable mentions of government ownership of industries, either
partial or complete; calls for keeping nationalised industries in state
hand or nationalising currently private industries. May also include
favourable mentions of government ownership of land.
label: nationalisation

title: Economic Orthodoxy
label: economic orthodoxy

title: Marxist Analysis
description_md:
Positive references to Marxist-Leninist ideology and specific use of
Marxist-Leninist terminology by the manifesto party (typically but not
necessary by communist parties).

*Note: This category was not used for Austria 1945-1979, for Australia,
Japan and the United States up to 1980; for Belgium, Ireland, The
Netherlands and New Zealand up to 1981; for Italy and Britain up to
1983; for Denmark, Luxembourg and Israel up to 1984; for Canada, France
and Sweden up to 1988.*
label: marxist analysis +

title: Anti-Growth Economy: Positive
description_md:
Favourable mentions of anti-growth politics. Rejection of the idea that
all growth is good growth. Opposition to growth that causes
environmental or societal harm. Call for sustainable economic
development. *For all documents that have been coded with version 5 of
the Coding Instructions this category is calculated as the sum of
per416\_1, and per416\_2.*

*Note: This category was not used for Austria 1945-1979, for Australia,
Japan and the United States up to 1980; for Belgium, Ireland, The
Netherlands and New Zealand up to 1981; for Italy and Britain up to
1983; for Denmark, Luxembourg and Israel up to 1984; for Canada, France
and Sweden up to 1988; and for Norway up to 1989. Test codings, however,
have shown that parties before the beginning of the 1990s hardly ever
advocated anti-growth policies.*
label: anti-growth economy +

title: Environmental Protection
label: environmentalism +

title: Culture: Positive
description_md:
Need for state funding of cultural and leisure facilities including arts
and sport. May include:

-   The need to fund museums, art galleries, libraries etc.;

-   The need to encourage cultural mass media and worthwhile leisure
    activities, such as public sport clubs.
label: culture +

title: Equality: Positive
label: equality +

title: Welfare State Expansion
description_md:
Favourable mentions of need to introduce, maintain or expand any public
social service or social security scheme. This includes, for example,
government funding of:

-   Health care

-   Child care

-   Elder care and pensions

-   Social housing

*Note: This category excludes education.*
label: welfare +

title: Welfare State Limitation
label: welfare -

title: Education Expansion
description_md:
Need to expand and/or improve educational provision at all levels.

*Note: This excludes technical training which is coded under 411.*
label: education +

title: Education Limitation
description_md:
Limiting state expenditure on education. May include:

-   The introduction or expansion of study fees at all educational
    levels

-   Increasing the number of private schools.
label: education -

title: National Way of Life: Positive
label: national way of life +

title: National Way of Life: Negative
description_md:
Unfavourable mentions of the manifesto country’s nation and history. May
include:

-   Opposition to patriotism;

-   Opposition to nationalism;

-   Opposition to the existing national state, national pride, and
    national ideas.

*For all documents that have been coded with version 5 of the Coding
Instructions this category is calculated as the sum of per602\_1, and
per602\_2.*
label: national way of life -

title: Traditional Morality: Positive
label: traditional morality +

title: Traditional Morality: Negative
label: traditional morality -

title: Law and Order: Positive
description_md:
Favourable mentions of strict law enforcement, and tougher actions
against domestic crime. Only refers to the enforcement of the status quo
of the manifesto country’s law code. May include:

-   Increasing support and resources for the police;

-   Tougher attitudes in courts;

-   Importance of internal security.

*For all documents that have been coded with version 5 of the Coding
Instructions this category is equal with per605\_1.*
label: law and order +

title: Civic Mindedness: Positive
label: civic mindedness +

title: Multiculturalism: Positive
description_md:
Favourable mentions of cultural diversity and cultural plurality within
domestic societies. May include the preservation of autonomy of
religious, linguistic heritages within the country including special
educational provisions.

*For all documents that have been coded with version 5 of the Coding
Instructions this category is calculated as the sum of per607\_1,
per607\_2, and per607\_3.*
label: multiculturalism +

title: Multiculturalism: Negative
description_md:
The enforcement or encouragement of cultural integration. Appeals for
cultural homogeneity in society.

*For all documents that have been coded with version 5 of the Coding
Instructions this category is calculated as the sum of per608\_1,
per608\_2, and per608\_3.*
label: multiculturalism -

title: Labour Groups: Positive
label: labour groups +

title: Labour Groups: Negative
description_md:
Negative references to labour groups and trade unions. May focus
specifically on the danger of unions ‘abusing power’.
label: labour groups -

title: Agriculture and Farmers: Positive
description_md:
Specific policies in favour of agriculture and farmers. Includes all
types of agriculture and farming practises. Only statements that have
agriculture as the key goal should be included in this category.

*For all documents that have been coded with version 5 of the Coding
Instructions this category is equal with per703\_1.*
label: agriculture +

title: Middle Class and Professional Groups
description_md:
General favourable references to the middle class. Specifically,
statements may include references to:

-   Professional groups, (e.g.: doctors or lawyers);

-   White collar groups, (e.g.: bankers or office employees),

-   Service sector groups (e.g.: IT industry employees);

-   Old and/or new middle class.

*Note: This is not an economical category but refers to the social
group(s).*
label: middle class and prof. groups

title: Underprivileged Minority Groups
description_md:
Very general favourable references to underprivileged minorities who are
defined neither in economic nor in demographic terms (e.g. the
handicapped, homosexuals, immigrants, indigenous). Only includes
favourable statements that cannot be classified in other categories
(e.g. 503, 504, 604, 607 etc.)
label: minority groups

title: Non-economic Demographic Groups
description_md:
General favourable mentions of demographically defined special interest
groups of all kinds. They may include:

-   Women;

-   University students;

-   Old, young, or middle aged people.

Might include references to assistance to these groups, but only if
these do not fall under other categories (e.g. 503 or 504).
label: non-economic demographic groups

title: Russia/USSR/CIS: Positive
description_md:
Favourable mentions of Russia, the USSR, the CMEA bloc or the Community
of Independent States.
label: russia +

title: Western States: Positive
description_md: Favourable mentions of Western states, including the USA and Germany.
label: western states +

title: Eastern European Countries: Positive
description_md: Favourable mentions of Eastern European countries in general.
label: eastern europe +

title: Baltic States: Positive
description_md:
Favourable mentions of the Baltic states, including other states
bordering the Baltic Sea.
label: baltic states +

title: Nordic Council: Positive
description_md: Favourable mentions of the Nordic Council.
label: nordic council +

title: SFR Yugoslavia: Positive
description_md:
Favourable mentions of countries formerly belonging to SFR Yugoslavia
including special relationships with Montenegro, Macedonia, Slovenia,
Croatia and Bosnia-Hercegovina.
label: yugoslavia +

title: Russia/USSR/CIS: Negative
description_md:
Negative mentions of Russia, the USSR or the Community of Independent
States.
label: russia -

title: Western States: Negative
description_md: Negative mentions of Western states, including the USA and Germany.
label: western states -

title: East European Countries: Negative
description_md: Negative mentions of Eastern European countries in general.
label: eastern europe -

title: Baltic States: Negative
description_md: Negative references to the Baltic states.
label: baltic states -

title: Nordic Council: Negative
description_md: Negative references to the Nordic Council.
label: nordic council -

title: SFR Yugoslavia: Negative
description_md:
Negative mentions of countries formerly belonging to SFR Yugoslavia
including negative references to Montenegro, Macedonia, Slovenia,
Croatia and Bosnia-Hercegovina.
label: yugoslavia -

title: Russian Army: Negative
description_md:
Need to withdraw the Russian army from the territory of the manifesto
country; need to receive reparations for the damage caused by the
Russian army or other Soviet institutions.
label: russian army -

title: Independence: Positive
description_md:
Favourable mentions of the independence and sovereignty of the manifesto
country.
label: independence +

title: Rights of Nations: Positive
description_md: Favourable mentions of freedom, rights and interests of nations.
label: rights of nations +

title: Transition to Democracy
description_md:
General references to the transition process of one-party states to
pluralist democracy.
label: transition to democracy

title: Restrictive Citizenship: Positive
description_md:
Favourable mentions of restrictions in citizenship; restrictions in
enfranchisement with respect to (ethnic) groups.
label: restrict citizenship +

title: Lax Citizenship: Positive
description_md:
Favourable mentions of lax citizenship and election laws; no or few
restrictions in enfranchisement.
label: lax citizenship +

title: Presidential Regime: Positive
description_md:
Support for current presidential regime; statements in favour of a
powerful presidency.
label: presidential regime +

title: Republic: Positive
description_md: Support for the republican form of government as opposed to monarchy.
label: republic +

title: Checks and Balances: Positive
description_md:
Support for checks and balances and separation of powers, and
specifically for limiting the powers of the presidency by increasing
legislative/judicial powers, or transferring some executive powers to
the legislature or judiciary.
label: checks and balances +

title: Monarchy: Positive
description_md:
Support for a monarchy, including conceptions of constitutional
monarchy.
label: monarchy +

title: Republican Powers: Positive
description_md: Favourable mentions of stronger republican powers.
label: republican powers +

title: Public Situation: Negative
description_md:
Negative references to the situation in public life after the founding
elections.
label: public situation -

title: Communist: Positive
description_md:
Co-operation with former authorities/communists in the transition
period; pro-communist involvement in the transition process; and ‘let
sleeping dogs lie’ in dealing with the nomenclature.
label: communist +

title: Communist: Negative
description_md:
Against communist involvement in democratic government; weeding out the
collaborators from governmental service; need for political coalition
except communist parties.
label: communist -

title: Rehabilitation and Compensation: Positive
description_md:
References to civic rehabilitation of politically persecuted people in
the communist era; references to juridical compensation concerning
communist expropriations; moral compensation.
label: rehabilitation +

title: Political Coalitions: Positive
description_md:
Positive references to the need of broader political coalition; need for
co-operation at the political level; necessity of collaboration among
all political forces.
label: coalitions +

title: Privatisation: Positive
description_md: Favourable references to privatisation.
label: privatization +

title: Control of Economy: Negative
description_md:
Negative references to the general need for direct governmental control
of the economy.
label: control economy -

title: Property-Restitution: Positive
description_md:
Favourable references to the physical restitution of property to
previous owners.
label: restitution +

title: Privatisation Vouchers: Positive
description_md: Favourable references to privatisation vouchers.
label: private vouchers +

title: Social Ownership: Positive
description_md:
Favourable references to the creation or preservation of co-operative or
non-state social ownership within a market economy.
label: social ownership +

title: Mixed Economy: Positive
description_md: Favourable references to mixed ownership within a market economy.
label: mixed economy +

title: Publicly-Owned Industry: Positive
description_md: Positive references to the concept of publicly-owned industries.
label: publicly owned industry +

title: Socialist Property: Positive
description_md:
Positive references to socialist property, including public and
co-operative property; negative references to privatisation.
label: socialist property +

title: Property-Restitution: Negative
description_md:
Negative references to the physical restitution of property to previous
owners.
label: property restitution -

title: Privatisation: Negative
description_md:
Negative references to the privatisation system; need to change the
privatisation system.
label: privatization -

title: Private-Public Mix in Culture: Positive
description_md:
Necessity of private provisions due to economic constraints; private
funding in addition to public activity.
label: priv-pub mix culture +

title: Private-Public Mix in Social Justice: Positive
description_md: Necessity of private initiatives due to economic constraints.
label: priv-pub mix social justice +

title: Private-Public Mix in Welfare: Positive
label: priv-pub mix welfare +

title: Private-Public Mix in Education: Positive
description_md:
Necessity of private education due to economic constraints; desirability
of competition in education.
label: priv-pub mix education +

title: The Karabakh Issue: Positive
description_md:
Positive references to the unity of Karabakh and Armenia or the
recognition of the independent Republic of Karabakh; rendering
assistance to Karabakh.
label: karabakh issue +

title: Rebuilding the USSR: Positive
description_md:
Favourable mentions of the reunification of all republics and nations
living on the former territory of the USSR into a new common
(democratic) state or into a common economic space whereby the new union
would be the guarantor of the manifesto country’s sovereignty; negative
references to the dissolution of the USSR and the respective treaties.
label: rebuilding USSR +

title: National Security: Positive
description_md:
Support for or need to maintain national security in all spheres of
social life; policies devoted to this goal.
label: national security +

title: Cyprus Issue
description_md:
All references concerning the division of Cyprus in a Greek and a
Turkish part.
label: cyprus issue

title: General Crisis
description_md: Identification of a general crisis in the country.
label: general crisis

title: Cultural Autonomy: Positive
description_md: Favourable mentions of cultural autonomy.
label: cultural autonomy +

title: Multiculturalism pro Roma: Positive
description_md: Favourable mentions of cultural autonomy of Roma.
label: multiculturalism roma +

title: Multiculturalism pro Roma: Negative
description_md: Negative mentions of cultural autonomy of Roma.
label: multiculturalism roma -

title: Minorities Inland:  Positive
description_md:
References to manifesto country minorities in foreign countries;
positive references to manifesto country minorities.
label: minorities inland +

title: Minorities Abroad: Positive
description_md:
References to ethnic minorities living in the manifesto country such as
Latvians living in Estonia.
label: minorities abroad -

title: War Participants: Positive
description_md:
Favourable mentions of, or need for, assistance to people taking part in
the war on the territory of ex-Yugoslavia.
label: war participants +

title: Refugees: Positive
description_md:
Favourable mentions of, or need for, assistance to people who left their
homes because of the war (for instance, on the territory of
ex-Yugoslavia) or were forcibly displaced.
label: refugees +

title: Anti-Imperialism: State Centred Anti-Imperialism
description_md:
Negative references to imperial behaviour and/or negative references to
one state exerting strong influence (political, military or commercial)
over other states. May also include:

-   Negative references to controlling other countries as if they were
    part of an empire;

-   Favourable references to greater self-government and independence
    for colonies;

-   Favourable mentions of de-colonisation.
label: state centred anti-imperalism

title: Anti-Imperialism: Foreign Financial Influence
label: foreign financial influence -

title: Freedom
label: freedom

title: Human Rights
description_md:
Favourable mentions of importance of human and civil rights in the
manifesto and other countries, including the right to freedom of speech,
press, assembly etc.; supportive refugee policies.
label: human rights

title: Democracy General: Positive
description_md:
Favourable mentions of democracy as the “only game in town”. General
support for the manifesto country’s democracy. May also include:

-   Democracy as method or goal in national, international or other
    organisations (e.g. labour unions, political parties etc.);

-   The need for the involvement of all citizens in political
    decision-making;

-   Support for parts of democratic regimes (rule of law, division of
    powers, independence of courts etc.).
label: democracy: general +

title: Democracy General: Negative
description_md:
Statements against the idea of democracy, in general or in the manifesto
country. Calls for reducing or withholding democratic rights from all or
certain groups of people. Calls for the introduction or maintaining of a
non-democratic regime, e.g. monarchy or rule of the military.
label: democracy: general -

title: Representative Democracy: Positive
description_md:
Favourable mentions of the system of representative democracy, in
particular in contrast to direct democracy. This includes the protection
of representative institutions and actors against direct democratic
elements.
label: representative democracy +

title: Direct Democracy: Positive
description_md:
Favourable mentions of the system of direct democracy, in particular in
contrast to representative democracy. This includes the call for the
introduction and/or extension of referenda, participatory budgets and
other forms of direct democracy.
label: direct democracy +

title: Political Authority: Party Competence
description_md:
References to the manifesto party’s competence to govern and/or other
party’s lack of such competence.
label: political authority: party competence

title: Political Authority: Personal Competence
description_md:
Reference to the presidential candidate’s or party leader’s personal
competence to govern and/or other candidate’s or leader’s lack of such
competence.
label: political authority: personal competence

title: Political Authority: Strong government
description_md:
Favourable mentions of the desirability of a strong and/or stable
government in general.
label: political authority: strong government

title: Transition: Pre-Democratic Elites: Positive
label: transition: pre-democratic elites +

title: Transition: Pre-Democratic Elites: Negative
description_md:
Against pre-democratic elite’s involvement in democratic government;
weeding out the collaborators of former, non-Democratic regime from
governmental service; for truth commissions and other institutions
illuminating recent history.
label: transition: pre-democratic elites -

title: Transition: Rehabilitation and Compensation
description_md:
References to civic rehabilitation of politically persecuted people in
the authoritarian era; references to juridical compensation concerning
authoritarian expropriations; moral compensation.

*Note: Specific policy positions overrule all subcategories of 305! If
there is no specific policy position, however, these subcategories may
apply.*
label: transition: rehabilitation and compensation

title: Anti-Growth Economy: Positive
description_md:
Favourable mentions of anti-growth politics. Rejection of the idea that
growth is good.
label: anti-growth economy +

title: Sustainability: Positive
description_md:
Call for sustainable economic development. Opposition to growth that
causes environmental or societal harm.
label: sustainability +

title: National Way of Life General: Positive
label: national way of life: general +

title: National Way of Life: Immigration: Negative
description_md:
Statement advocating the restriction of the process of immigration, i.e.
accepting new immigrants. Might include statements regarding:

-   Immigration being a threat to national character of the manifesto
    country;

-   ‘the boat is full’ argument;

-   The introduction of migration quotas, including restricting
    immigration from specific countries or regions etc.

*Only concerned with the possibility of new immigrants. For negative
statements regarding immigrants already in the manifesto country, please
see 608\_1.*
label: national way of life: immigration -

title: National Way of Life General: Negative
label: national way of life: general -

title: National Way of Life: Immigration: Positive
description_md:
Statements favouring new immigrants; against restrictions and quotas;
rejection of the ‘boat is full’ argument. Includes allowing new
immigrants for the benefit of the manifesto country’s economy. *Only
concerned with the possibility of new immigrants. For positive
statements regarding immigrants already in the manifesto country, please
see 607\_1.*
label: national way of life: immigration +

title: Law and Order: Positive
label: law and order +

title: Law and Order: Negative
label: law and order -

title: Civic Mindedness General: Positive
label: civic mindedness: general +

title: Civic Mindedness: Bottom-Up Activism
description_md:
Appeals to grassroots movements of social change; banding all sections
of society together to overcome common adversity and hardship; appeals
to the people as a united actor.
label: bottom-up activism

title: Multiculturalism General: Positive
description_md:
Favourable mentions of cultural diversity and cultural plurality within
domestic societies. May include the preservation of autonomy of
religious, linguistic heritages within the country including special
educational provisions.
label: multiculturalism: general +

title: Multiculturalism: Immigrants Diversity
description_md:
Statements favouring the idea that immigrants keep their cultural
traits; voluntary integration; state providing opportunities to
integrate.

*Only concerned with immigrants already in the manifesto country. For
positive statements regarding the possibility of new immigrants, please
see 602\_2.*
label: multiculturalism: immigrants diversity

title: Multiculturalism: Indigenous rights: Positive
label: multiculturalism: indigenous rights +

title: Multiculturalism General: Negative
description_md:
The enforcement or encouragement of cultural integration. Appeals for
cultural homogeneity in society.
label: multiculturalism: general -

title: Multiculturalism: Immigrants Assimilation
description_md:
Calls for immigrants that are in the country to adopt the manifesto
country’s culture and fully assimilate. Reinforce integration.

*Only concerned with immigrants already in the manifesto country. For
negative statements regarding the possibility of new immigrants, please
see 601\_2*
label: multiculturalism: immigrants assimilation

title: Multiculturalism: Indigenous rights: Negative
description_md: Rejection of idea of special protection for indigenous people.
label: multiculturalism: indigenous rights -

title: Agriculture and Farmers: Positive
description_md:
Specific policies in favour of agriculture and farmers. Includes all
types of agriculture and farming practises. Only statements that have
agriculture as the key goal should be included in this category.
label: agriculture and farmers +

title: Agriculture and Farmers: Negative
label: agriculture and farmers -
